definition: building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant

sentences.english: To some men marriage is a bit like being in a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 對有的男人來說，結婚就有點像上館子。

sentences.english: The meal we had at the restaurant was rather betwixt and between.
sentences.chinese: 我們在那家館子喫的那頓飯菜很一般。

sentences.english: They usually eat out on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 星期天他們通常上館子喫飯。

sentences.english: We ate out to celebrate Mom's birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我們上館子喫飯來慶祝媽媽的生日。

sentences.english: I'm too tired to cook. Shall we eat out tonight?
sentences.chinese: 我太累了不想做飯了。我們上館子怎麼樣？

sentences.english: You always have water when dining out.
sentences.chinese: 下館子的時候你總要點水喝。

sentences.english: The restaurant didn't have a liquor licence, but they allowed you to brown bag.
sentences.chinese: 那家館子沒有酒牌，不過允許客人自帶酒水。

sentences.english: Ms. Gail's parents, who had been living comfortably in retirement, quit dining out.
sentences.chinese: 過着悠閒退休生活的父母也不再下館子喫飯了。

sentences.english: Don’t miss the highlight of Paris evening: eating out.
sentences.chinese: 別錯過了巴黎夜晚的高潮:下館子。

sentences.english: Japanese businessman invited a Jewish painter to eat out.
sentences.chinese: 有一個日本商人請一位猶太畫家上館子喫飯。

sentences.english: Restaurants are great, but can they beat a homecooked meal?
sentences.chinese: 餐館好雖好，但上館子會比喫自家烹調的餐點更好嗎？

sentences.english: Residents in Shanghai paid the highest price for dining out as each time they spent RMB88 per person.
sentences.chinese: 其中上海市民下館子最貴，人均餐飲消費88元。

sentences.english: The restaurant was not fancy, but it was obviously popular.
sentences.chinese: 那家館子店面普通，不過明顯生意火爆。

sentences.english: "It's more expensive than eating in a restaurant, " complained one driver who gave his surname as Lu.
sentences.chinese: “這甚至比下館子還要貴”，一位姓陸的司機抱怨說。

sentences.english: So I took him to an inn and bought him a four-course meal.
sentences.chinese: 於是我帶他去了家館子，請了他一頓四道菜的大餐。

sentences.english: Would you mind eating out this evening?
sentences.chinese: 你介意今晚上館子喫飯嗎？

definition: to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
hot spicy soup (often sold in street stalls)
